intro: Diplotaxis viminea f. prolongoi, commonly known as the long-stemmed African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are linear and often have a slight pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
